oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Department of Energy Photograph Collection
Ceremony for first sale of radioisotopes to Barnard Free Skin and Cancer Hospital
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Four men stand in front of a large group of people. Other people stand on a staircase and on a walkway above the four men.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Clinton Laboratory; Industrial technicians; Interiors; Military uniforms; Oak Ridge National Laboratory; Radioisotopes; Soldiers
Cowdry, E. V.; Kirkpatrick, Elmer E.; Sandidge, Prescott; Wigner, Eugene Paul, 1902-
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: See Oak Ridge Journal of August 8, 1946 which identifies the four men facing the crowd from left to right; Prescott Sandidge, Dr. E. P. Wigner, Dr. E. V. Cowdry, and Col. E. E. Kirkpatrick, commander of Clinton Engineer Works.
1870-15; Clinton Laboratory; 8-2-1946; Sale of First Radioisotope By Dr. L. P. Wigner to Dr. E. V. Cowdry of Barnard Skin & Cancer Hospital St Louis, Mo
